poem:
Title: Between Stares and Silence

To Geneva we committed ghosts, 
presidents eye to eye, specters close.
In the library of a lakeside villa,
a warning spoken over tranquil villa.

Rumblings of the mighty toppled, 
the echo of a threat, bottled.
When Navalny's quiet fell in Russian land, 
Biden's stare was an empty hand. 

A loss in words, the stark reminder,
of power beyond the beholder.
